results.title: The Lavender Hill Mob
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
This comedy stars Alec Guinness as an underpaid bank clerk who plans and executes a gold robbery but his colleagues’ attempt to hide the loot leads to bizarre and suspenseful complications. Also features Stanley Holloway and Sidney James. Won Academy award for Best story and screenplay.

results.title: The Ladies' man; Lord Byron lived here; The Lift
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hancock’s half hour”.
Three episodes from the British television comedy series “Hancock” starring Tony Hancock. 1. The Ladies man: Hancock decides to take things into his own hands and improve his success rate with the opposite sex. 2. Lord Byron lives here: The discovery of scribblings by the great poet Byron leads Hancock to open his house as a stately home, exploit the American tourists and make a fortune at the same time. The Lift: What a captive audience has top put up with when Hancock tips the balance of one too many in the lift and the lift won’t budge.

results.title: The Land before time: the big freeze
results.brief_description: This animated children’s film is the seventh sequel to Don Bluth’s “The Land before time” (1988) and continues the adventures of Littlefoot, a young and impetuous apatosaurus. In this instalment Littlefoot lives contentedly with his elderly grandparents in Great Valley, but when they experience a snowstorm for the first time, excitement turns to concern upon realising that significant climate change odes badly for the dinosaur community. Ducky, an anatosaurus, experiences sibling rivalry, resentful of her adopted brother, Spike, a stegosaurus who has to decide whether to join his own migrating tribe or stay with his adoptive family. When several family members become stranded and their lives are imperilled, Ducky learns the value of respecting her elders, particularly Mr Thicknose, a dinosaur with whom he falls into constant conflict. Although the plot is trite, and the dialogue cloying, this animated children’s movie still entertains as it imagines the world inhabited by dinosaurs. Features frequent musical interludes and the voices of Jeff Bennett, Rob Paulsen, Aria Noelle Curzon, Thomas Dekker, Robert Guillaume, Susan Krebs and Kenneth Mars.

results.title: The Lady from Grey County
results.creator_credit: Janice H Brown, Margaret Wescott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: On March 8, 1922, Agnes Campbell Macphail became Canada’s first woman Member of Parliament. For the next nineteen years, the Independent MP used her wit, courage and honesty to fight for prison reform, old-age pensions, the co-operative movement and the many other causes she believed in. Made up of old photographs, archival footage and quotations from her speeches and writings, this film documents a significant Canadian and the turbulence of her times. Agnes Campbell Macphail died on February 13, 1954.

results.title: The Lady and the owl
results.creator_credit: William Canning, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From all over Canada people bring injured owls to Kate and Larry McKeevers of Ontario who have devoted the past ten years of their lives to the care of the species. Mrs McKeevers, in particular, is fascinated by them and explains their habits and anatomy. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: The King of New York
results.creator_credit: Abel Ferrara, Mary Kane, Vittorio Squillante and Reteitalia
results.brief_description: Christopher Walken stars as a drug lord turned good guy in this crime film directed by Abel Ferrara. Frank White is released from prison, a reformed man and sets out to take over New York City, in order to prevent the closure of a hospital in the South Bronx where he grew up. With the help of a few gangster friends, he begins to take over the entire drug industry in the city, killing those standing in his way. As his takeover begins to succeed he brings in more recruits, but unknowingly starts a underground war between crime groups in the city. Cast also includes Larry Fishburne, Wesley Snipes, David Caruso and Steve Buscemi.

results.title: A Brush with nature, Robert Ulmann
results.creator_credit: Toni Steinbrecher, ABC-TV (Australia) and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
The return of the southern right whale to Australia’s southern coast is observed and recorded in the art of Swiss-Australian wildlife artist, Robert Ulmann. He has found a new life in an area that most Australians would avoid as desolate, dangerous and bleak.

results.title: The Koala quandry
results.creator_credit: John Muirhead, Dione Gilmour and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
An examination of the feeding and habitat of the koala, the likely survival of the species in the face of environmental and biological threats is discussed.
